column4: how to estimate the operating system performance .. is there any tool to do that
you can see how much cpu and memory s used by running top or you can use the default system monitor (also gives network usage, etc) for a basic look at the performance
what is the default sytem monitor
you can find it under System, Administration  and its in there as System Monitor
the system monitor is 'gnome-system-monitor' if you need that
after using this tool .. how can i control it
what is it that you want to get out of it?

there are 4 tabs - System: just info on the computer, Resources: just shows usage of memory, cpu and network (can change update rate in preferences), File systems just shows all filesystems that are mounted and their usage, Process is a list of processes that you can configure to show different types of processes from view, and configure what info is shown in preferences and update speed and you can order the process in
is there any tool to test the  operating system efficency
efficiency at what? there are a variety of benchmarking tools available that test different aspects of a system (you can get some from http://www.phoronix.com)
how can i say the ubuntu operating system is a best one ..
when i ask others to use the ubuntu .. they asked me this question ..
if you look at http://www.phoronix.com you will see a lot of benchmarks of linux there that test a lot of things - a recent one was the performance of java on windows vs linux (linux won :D )
